excerpt: One of the largest mosques in the world, topped with 82 white domes of varying sizes.
detail_description: The Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque is a stunning architectural marvel located in Abu Dhabi. It boasts 82 white domes of various sizes, making it one of the largest mosques globally. The mosque, constructed between 1996 and 2007, is made of white marble and features four minarets that stand over 100 meters tall.
name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
address: Al Rawdah - W54 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Motor racing-themed complex with thrill & family rides, driving simulators & car factory tour.
detail_description: Ferrari World Yas Island, Abu Dhabi is a motor racing-themed complex featuring thrilling rides, driving simulators, and a car factory tour. It's located approximately 34.5 km from attractions like the Louvre Abu Dhabi and the Grand Mosque. The park boasts nearly 40 different rides and attractions adorned in the iconic red and yellow colors of Ferrari.
name: Ferrari World Yas Island, Abu Dhabi
address: Yas Island - YS1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Innovative museum surrounded by water, featuring ancient to modern art pieces, kayaking & a cafe.
detail_description: Louvre Abu Dhabi is an innovative museum located in the United Arab Emirates capital, surrounded by water and featuring a diverse collection of ancient to modern art pieces. Visitors can enjoy kayaking and relax at the on-site cafe. The museum, designed by Jean Nouvel, opened at the end of 2017 and has since become a cultural hotspot in Abu Dhabi.
name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
address: Saadiyat, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Palace & fort around which Abu Dhabi was built, now a museum with cultural programmes & festivals.
detail_description: Qasr Al Hosn is a historic palace and fort in Abu Dhabi, dating back to 1795. It was previously inaccessible to the public but has now been transformed into a museum with cultural programs and festivals. The site includes the historic fort, the Cultural Foundation, the National Consultative Council building, and the House of Artisans. Visitors can learn about the city's history and its important cultural tradition of Al Sadu weaving by Bedouin women, recognized by UNESCO.
name: Qasr Al Hosn
address: Rashid Bin Saeed Al Maktoum St(2nd St), Al Hisn - W3 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: The first & the largest hospital in the world to be dedicated entirely to the hawk.
detail_description: Located on Sweihan Road in Al Shamkhah, Abu Dhabi Falcon Hospital is the world's largest hospital dedicated solely to falcons. Established in 1999 by the Environment Agency - Abu Dhabi, it offers comprehensive veterinary care services exclusively for these majestic birds. The hospital aims to preserve and protect the health of falcons in the UAE while promoting research and conservation efforts.
name: Abu Dhabi Falcon Hospital
address: طريق سوِيحَان, near the Abu Dhabi International Airport, Al Shamkhah - SH34 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Indoor amusement park with rides & shows based on Warner Bros. cartoon characters & superheroes.
detail_description: Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi on Yas Island is an indoor amusement park featuring rides and shows based on Warner Bros. cartoon characters and superheroes. It's conveniently located near various amenities such as hospitals, schools, hotels, malls, and entertainment options like Reem Central Park and Ferrari World. Additionally, there are plenty of nearby dining options and supermarkets for convenience. The park is easily accessible from Abu Dhabi International Airport and offers a fun-filled experience for visitors of all ages.
name: Warner Bros. World™ Yas Island, Abu Dhabi
address: Yas Island - YS4 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Reconstruction of a traditional desert village with a regular roster of events & exhibitions.
detail_description: Located near Marina Mall in Abu Dhabi, Emirates Heritage Village is a reconstructed Arab village run by the Emirates Heritage Club. It offers visitors a glimpse into traditional Emirati culture and lifestyle before the discovery of oil in the region. The village showcases the Bedouin way of life with traditional tents, coffee, and displays of the Falaj irrigation system used for palm grove irrigation. With regular events and exhibitions, it's a popular destination for those interested in experiencing authentic Emirati heritage.
name: Emirates Heritage Village
address: القرية التراثية, Abu Dhabi Theatre Rd, Corniche - Breakwater Road, near Marina Mall - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Varied destination for adrenalin-fueled waterslides & static surfing waves, plus shopping & dining.
detail_description: Yas Waterworld Abu Dhabi, situated on Yas Island, is a thrilling water park offering an array of attractions for visitors of all ages. The park features exhilarating water slides, family-friendly rides, and entertainment options. Inspired by Emirati culture and history, the park spans over 15 hectares with more than 40 rides and slides. Visitors can enjoy activities such as surfing at Bubbles Barrel, experiencing the Dawwama tornado water coaster, or taking part in the Water Wars.
name: Yas Waterworld Abu Dhabi
address: Yas Island - YS4 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Domed marble & limestone presidential palace with a mosaic-clad great hall & extensive library.
detail_description: Qasr Al Watan, located at one end of Abu Dhabi's main Corniche, is a grand presidential palace made of domed marble and limestone. Open to the public since 2019, it has quickly become a cherished cultural gem in the UAE. For an entry fee of Dhs60, visitors can explore its ornate interior featuring a mosaic-clad great hall, an extensive library with towering bookshelves, and exhibits that narrate the rich history of the nation.
name: Qasr Al Watan
address: Al Ras Al Akhdar - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: City beach with international clean-water status & ropes limited the available swimming distance.
detail_description: Corniche Beach in Abu Dhabi is a popular city beach with international clean-water status. The main beachfront stretches for eight kilometers, offering white sand, turquoise water, and a beautifully landscaped boulevard. Divided into several sections with lifeguarded beaches, it caters to families and action-seekers alike. The chic promenade features food stalls, cafes, and sitting-out areas that create a tropical paradise ambiance.
name: Corniche Beach
address: Al Bateen - W10 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Wildlife park including elephant- & giraffe-feeding sessions, bird-of-prey shows & entertainment.
detail_description: Emirates Park Zoo and Resort is a captivating destination in the UAE, offering an array of educational and entertaining experiences. Visitors can engage in animal feeding sessions, watch captivating animal shows, and partake in thrilling activities such as ziplining and car adventures. The zoo boasts a diverse range of wildlife, providing guests with opportunities to interact with farm animals as well as exotic species. For those seeking a more leisurely experience, the Arabian Wildlife Park and Al Ain Zoo offer unparalleled wildlife encounters.
name: Emirates Park Zoo and Resort
address: 12th St, Al Bahyah - Al Bahyah Farms 2 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Small island with a Grand Prix car-racing circuit, amusement parks, a beach & a golf course.
detail_description: Yas Island is a small island located just 20 kilometers east of Abu Dhabi city center. It is known for its Grand Prix car-racing circuit, amusement parks, a beach, and a golf course. The island offers unlimited access to theme parks, shopping malls, sports arenas, trendy restaurants, and luxurious residential properties. Yas Marina Circuit is one of the main attractions on the island and hosts various motorsport competitions and events.
name: Yas Island
address: Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Light-filled 3-level mall with international retailers & eateries, plus a 20-screen cinema.
detail_description: Yas Mall, located at the heart of Yas Island and just 20 minutes from downtown Abu Dhabi, is a sprawling three-level shopping haven that offers an array of international retailers, dining options, and entertainment facilities. With its 370 stores spanning over 2.5 million square feet, this luxury mall boasts renowned brands like American Eagle Outfitters, Calvin Klein, Bershka, and Lacoste. Additionally, it features a 20-screen cinema for movie enthusiasts.
name: Yas Mall
address: Yas Island - ياس غرب - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Vast retail, dining & entertainment centre with designer stores, plus a bowling alley & an ice rink.
detail_description: Marina Mall Abu Dhabi is a premier shopping destination located near Heritage Village on the Breakwater in the southwest corner of Abu Dhabi city. This expansive complex boasts over 400 stores, including designer boutiques, and offers a diverse range of entertainment options such as a bowling alley, movie theater, ice rink, and amusement center with arcade games and rides. Visitors can also indulge in various dining experiences at the numerous restaurants and cafes or explore the sprawling food court.
name: Marina Mall Abu Dhabi
address: Marina Mall, Ring Road, Al Kasir - Al Marina - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Private, 500m white-sand beach featuring shaded sunloungers, plus a relaxed restaurant with a bar.
detail_description: Kai Beach Saadiyat is a secluded 500m stretch of pristine white sand, offering shaded sun loungers and a laid-back restaurant with a bar. It's an ideal destination for families or groups with diverse interests. Visitors can relax on the beach, take part in water sports, and enjoy thrilling aquatic activities. The beach's bistro provides a refreshing escape from the sun, allowing guests to savor their favorite cocktails before returning to the beach for more fun.
name: Kai Beach Saadiyat
address: Al Saadiyat Island - SDN1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Entertainment & shopping complex with family dining, a cinema, supervised play areas & 200 shops.
detail_description: Located in downtown Abu Dhabi, the expansive Abu Dhabi Mall offers a plethora of shopping and entertainment options. With over 200 retail stores, visitors can explore popular brands like Zara and shop for fragrant perfumes. The mall also features a Fitness First outlet for those looking to squeeze in a workout. Families can enjoy supervised play areas such as Prison Island and Xtreme Zone for older kids, while Vox Cinemas offers the latest movie releases.
name: Abu Dhabi Mall
address: Al Zahiyah - E16 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Mangrove forest with over 60 species of birds, plus channels for kayaking & other water activities.
detail_description: Mangrove Marine National Park, located in the UAE, encompasses nearly 75% of the country's mangrove forest area. The park features a diverse ecosystem including salt marshes, mudflats, and forests that are home to various marine animals such as turtles, crabs, and fish. It also hosts a wide range of bird species like western reef herons and greater flamingos.
name: Mangrove Marine National Park
address: FC4G+M3J, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: 74th-floor lookout with 360º city views (entrance fee), plus a cafe serving high tea.
detail_description: Nestled on the 74th floor of the iconic Etihad Towers, the Observation Deck at 300 offers an unparalleled experience for visitors seeking breathtaking views of Abu Dhabi. Standing at a remarkable height of 300 meters, this observation point provides a stunning 360-degree panorama that encompasses the city's skyline, the picturesque Corniche, and the shimmering Arabian Gulf. It's not just about the views; guests can indulge in a delightful afternoon tea while soaking in the luxurious atmosphere.
name: Observation Deck at 300
address: Tower 2, Level 74 King Abdullah Bin Abdulaziz Al Saud St, Al Bateen - W32 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Contemporary complex of 5 towers offering shopping, dining, luxury lodging & an observation deck.
detail_description: Etihad Towers is a contemporary complex of five towers in Abu Dhabi, offering a mix of shopping, dining, luxury accommodations, and an observation deck. The Avenue at Etihad Towers is a high-end retail destination featuring luxury brands like Hermes, Cartier, and Rolex as well as exclusive restaurants and commercial spaces. Known for its modern architecture and often featured in postcards, the complex includes offices, apartments, and hotels.
name: Etihad Towers
address: F85C+FPM, King Abdullah Bin Abdulaziz Al Saud St, opp. Emirates Palace Hotel - Al Bateen - W32 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Picturesque beach for swimming, basking, fishing & picnics, with kayak & jet ski rentals.
detail_description: Al Bateen Beach, located in Abu Dhabi, is a picturesque and tranquil public beach offering stunning views of Hudariyat Island. With its fine sand and gentle waves, it's an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, fishing, and picnics. The beach provides amenities such as sun beds, umbrellas, and children's play areas. It's popular among locals and tourists alike for its ladies-only section and shallow waters suitable for families with young kids.
name: Al Bateen Beach
address: Khalifa Al Mubarak St, Al Qurm - Qasr Al Shatie - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Low-elevation, developed island with a variety of museums, plus a marina with hotels & resorts.
detail_description: Saadiyat Island, which translates to "Happiness Island" in Arabic, is a low-lying island that has been developed into a cultural and luxury destination. It is home to New York University's outpost and the Manarat Al Saadiyat arts center. The island features planned cultural buildings designed by renowned architects such as Tadao Ando, Sir Norman Foster, Frank Gehry, Zaha Hadid, and Jean Nouvel.
name: Saadiyat Island
address: Al Saadiyat Island - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: This spacious, vibrant park features a shade house, botanic garden, amphitheater & large open lawn.
detail_description: Umm Al Emarat Park in downtown Abu Dhabi is a stunning green space with lush lawns, date palms, and meandering paths. It has received the prestigious Green Flag Award and underwent a significant renovation in 2015. The park now boasts an indoor Botanic Garden, a dedicated Children's Garden, and a towering Shade House offering panoramic views of the surroundings. Visitors can also enjoy The Ripe Market on Saturdays, featuring an array of fresh organic produce.
name: Umm Al Emarat Park
address: 15th Street, Mushrif Area, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Zaha Hadid–designed suspension bridge known for its intricate construction & dramatic lighting.
detail_description: Sheikh Zayed Bridge, designed by the renowned architect Zaha Hadid, is a symbol of grandeur in Abu Dhabi. This 842-meter-long suspension bridge is an architectural marvel, incorporating traditional Islamic and Arab art styles. Its curved arches resemble the desert's sand dunes and are illuminated with subtle colors at dusk, creating a mesmerizing sight over the Maqtah Channel.
name: Sheikh Zayed Bridge
address: CFFP+JFC, Sas Al Nakhl - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Circuit for Formula 1 events & amateur driving programs, plus a go-kart track & fitness events.
detail_description: Dive into the exhilarating realm of motorsports at Yas Marina Circuit, located on the vibrant Yas Island in Abu Dhabi. This modern racing venue offers an engaging guided tour that lasts between 90 to 120 minutes, making it a must-visit for both tourists and motorsport aficionados alike. Starting from Yas Central, where you can find the Yas Racing School, visitors are whisked away on an air-conditioned bus to explore various highlights of this iconic circuit.
name: Yas Marina Circuit
address: Yas Central, Yas Leisure Dr, Yas Island - YS1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Mushrif Kids Park, also known as Umm Al Emarat Park, is a spacious and well-maintained park located in Abu Dhabi. Spanning across 14.5 hectares, it offers various educational and recreational activities for visitors of all ages. The park boasts a nice playground and wide jogging paths, making it an ideal spot for families to relax and enjoy outdoor activities.
name: Mushrif Kids Park
address: C9VV+V5J, old mushrif, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Upscale shopping with numerous family & fine dining restaurants in an Arabic-style glass building
detail_description: The Galleria Al Maryah Island is an elegant shopping destination located in the heart of Abu Dhabi's new Central Business District. Housed in a stunning Arabic-style glass building, it offers over 130 world-renowned brand outlets, including 50 firsts for Abu Dhabi. Visitors can explore designer labels and high-end brands such as Jimmy Choo, Celine, and Alexander McQueen.
name: The Galleria Al Maryah Island
address: 107 Hamouda Bin Ali Al Dhaheri St, Al Maryah Island - MI10 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Sleek centre for interactive local cultural displays & international exhibitions, plus a theatre.
detail_description: Manarat Al Saadiyat is a prominent cultural institution in Abu Dhabi, located on Saadiyat Island. The museum showcases a diverse range of local and international art and cultural exhibitions, offering an interactive experience for visitors. With a vast space spanning 15,400 square meters, the museum houses renowned works of art including ancient artifacts, Islamic calligraphy, and historical photographs. It also serves as a hub for community engagement by organizing workshops and activities for all ages.
name: Manarat Al Saadiyat
address: Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan Hwy, Al Saadiyat Island - Cultural District - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: SeaWorld Yas Island in Abu Dhabi offers an immersive marine experience with a variety of marine life, captivating shows, and interactive exhibits. The expansive 183,000 square meter park features over 58 million liters of water housing diverse marine animals such as sea turtles, sharks, and rays. It is recommended to purchase tickets online in advance to avoid long lines at the ticket counter. Valet parking is available for convenience. The park offers a range of activities suitable for families and walking enthusiasts.
name: SeaWorld Abu Dhabi | سي وورلد جزيرة ياس، أبوظ
address: Yas Island - YS6 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: The Cultural District is a vibrant and dynamic area that showcases the rich cultural heritage of the city. It is home to numerous art galleries, theaters, museums, and historical landmarks, offering visitors a diverse range of cultural experiences. The district's lively atmosphere is enhanced by street performers, local artisans, and an array of dining options that reflect the area's multicultural influences. With its bustling energy and creative spirit, the Cultural District provides a captivating immersion into the arts and traditions of the community.
name: Cultural District
address: Al Saadiyat Island - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, sits off the mainland on an island in the Persian (Arabian) Gulf. Its focus on oil exports and commerce is reflected by the skyline’s modern towers and shopping megacenters such as Abu Dhabi and Marina malls. Beneath white-marble domes, the vast Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque features an immense Persian carpet, crystal chandeliers and capacity for 41,000 worshipers.
detail_description: Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, is situated on an island in the Persian Gulf. The city's skyline is dominated by modern towers and expansive shopping centers like Abu Dhabi and Marina malls. The impressive Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque showcases stunning architecture and can accommodate up to 41,000 worshipers. Additionally, Khalifa University of Science and Technology, located in Abu Dhabi, offers a wide range of academic programs and research opportunities across various disciplines.
name: Abu Dhabi
address: United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Masdar City is an urban community in Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates. It was built by Masdar, a subsidiary of the state-owned Mubadala Investment Company, with the majority of seed capital provided by the Government of Abu Dhabi. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Masdar City is a sustainable urban development located in Abu Dhabi, UAE. It was constructed by Masdar, a subsidiary of the Mubadala Investment Company, with initial funding from the Abu Dhabi government. The city features innovative technologies and environmentally friendly designs to create a modern and eco-friendly community. Additionally, visitors can enjoy various amenities such as cafes like Jims Kitchen and Vincis cafe that offer diverse menus and family-friendly facilities.
name: Masdar City
address: Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Notable, modern war memorial offering 3 structures & a pond that's known for its view of the mosque.
detail_description: Wahat Al Karama, or the Oasis of Dignity, stands as a poignant tribute to the brave souls who sacrificed their lives for the United Arab Emirates since 1971. Nestled directly across from the magnificent Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, this modern war memorial features three striking structures and a serene pond that offers stunning views of the mosque.
name: Wahat Al Karama
address: 3rd St Khor, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Nurai Island is an exclusive island destination in the UAE, accessible by a short-speed boat ride from the capital. The island boasts white-sand beaches and cerulean seas, reminiscent of the Maldives. It is home to a super exclusive luxury resort with private villas, but day passes are available for those who want to enjoy the beach and pool without staying overnight. The day pass includes a boat transfer and credit for food & beverage, spa treatments, and activities on the island.
name: Nurai Island
address: Nourai Island - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Completed in 2011, this iconic 35-story leaning skyscraper houses a hotel & offices.
detail_description: Capital Gate, also known as the Leaning Tower of Abu Dhabi, is a 35-story skyscraper completed in 2011. It is an iconic structure that houses a hotel and offices. Designed by RMJM architects, it was inspired by the Leaning Tower of Pisa and holds the Guinness World Record for being the furthest leaning manmade tower.
name: Capital Gate
address: Al Rawdah - W59 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Jubail Mangrove Park is a must-visit destination in Abu Dhabi, offering an opportunity to explore and learn about the native species while spotting wildlife such as turtles and herons. The park features meandering boardwalks that allow visitors to wander through the mangroves, making it a family-friendly place that emphasizes the importance of nature. Located within a protected area, it boasts a unique intertidal marine setting and supports a diverse ecosystem with native bird and fish species.
name: Jubail Mangrove Park
address: Al Jubail Island - JN - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Quiet, artificial island with views of Abu Dhabi's Corniche & skyscrapers from a palm-backed beach.
detail_description: Al Lulu Island, located off the coast of Abu Dhabi, is a serene and artificial island offering stunning views of the city's skyline and the Corniche. The palm-backed beach is known for its mesmerizing blue sea and vibrant atmosphere. Visitors can explore St. Joseph Catholic Church or take a tour of Sheikh Zayed Cricket Stadium. The island also features several malls for shopping enthusiasts.
name: Al Lulu Island
address: Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: The National Aquarium Abu Dhabi, established in 2021, has quickly become a must-visit destination for families. As the largest public aquarium in the city, it offers an array of zones to explore, such as the Red Sea Wreck and The Sub. Visitors can encounter diverse marine life from various habitats, including a seven-meter-long python known as Super Snake.
name: The National Aquarium Abu Dhabi
address: Al Qana, Rabdan - RB6 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: The Emirates Palace Mandarin Oriental in Abu Dhabi offers a unique and extraordinary culinary experience at Shang Palace, where local influences blend with oriental dishes to create one-of-a-kind flavors. The afternoon tea ceremony at the luxurious restaurant provides a tasteful and delicious experience, with attentive service and comfortable seating. Guests praise the exemplary staff, fantastic value for money, and exceptional coffee and cake. Visitors highly recommend this gem of a place for its overall exemplary experience.
name: Episodes at Emirates Palace Mandarin Oriental
address: West Corniche Road, Al Ras Al Akhdar - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Corniche is a popular recreational area and public beach in Abu Dhabi, UAE. It offers a variety of activities such as walking along the beach, swimming, cycling, filming, and photo shoots. The infrastructure is well-planned with top-notch amenities and a superb walking track with neat lighting. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful landmarks alongside the Corniche and Marina while taking in the peaceful and calm beach atmosphere. Dogs are allowed on the surrounding areas for walks, making it an inclusive destination for all to enjoy.
name: Corniche
address: F89H+3RV, Corniche Bike Track, Al Bateen - W10 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: The Heritable Village in Abu Dhabi offers a unique glimpse into the pre-oil era of the Gulf region, showcasing the humble beginnings of both Abu Dhabi and the UAE. It's a great starting point for learning about their history and appreciating the hard work and contributions of previous generations to the country's success. The village features museums, camel and horse rides, shopping opportunities, and a beautiful beach view.
name: Heritable village Abu Dhabi
address: 106 Khamis Bin Zaal Al Rumaithi St, Al Kasir - Al Marina - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Large mall with fashion, homeware and department stores, a food court and a 14-screen cinema.
detail_description: Dalma Mall is a prominent shopping complex in Abu Dhabi, conveniently located near the international airport. Boasting around 400 stores featuring leading national and international brands, it offers an extensive range of fashion, homeware, and department stores. The mall covers 151,000 square meters and caters to the middle and upper-income groups with its retail section, departmental stores, Carrefour hypermart, food court, and various unique services.
name: Dalma Mall
address: Al Wazn St, Abu Dhabi Industrial City - ICAD I - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: The Zayed National Museum, located in Abu Dhabi and set to open in 2025, is a tribute to the late Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the founding father of the UAE. The museum's design by Foster + Partners features glass atriums resembling falcon wings, paying homage to the national bird and symbolizing the country's heritage. It aims to narrate the story of Sheikh Zayed's unification of emirates and his international relations.
name: Zayed National Museum
address: Al Saadiyat Island - Cultural District - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Experience the thrill of the Abu Dhabi Desert Safari, located in the Al Khaznah desert region. This popular activity offers adventure lovers a chance to capture stunning sunset and sunrise views amidst the eternal sands. The area's breathtaking dunes make it a sought-after destination for desert safaris, offering an exhilarating ride akin to a rollercoaster experience. Tour companies provide pick-up from Abu Dhabi hotels and transport visitors in Toyota Land Cruisers to the meet-up point in the desert.
name: Abu Dhabi Desert Safari
address: 8 Al Bahhar St, Hisn - Al Markaziyah West - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Nestled just a few blocks away, The Founder’s Memorial stands as a tribute to Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the first president of the UAE. This remarkable site features stunning gardens ideal for leisurely walks and offers engaging multimedia presentations that delve into the life and legacy of this influential leader. A highlight is the Constellation, an eye-catching three-dimensional portrait of Sheikh Zayed that captures his essence beautifully.
name: The Founder’s Memorial
address: Al Ras Al Akhdar - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

excerpt: Large center with global chain retailers, a grocery store, 50+ eateries, a cinema & kids' areas.
detail_description: Al Wahda Mall, established in 2007, is a premier shopping destination in Abu Dhabi that attracts over 30 million visitors annually. Spanning across 3.3 million square feet, the mall features over 350 brands including global chain retailers, a grocery store, and more than 50 eateries. It boasts an impressive retail mix covering fashion, jewelry, electronics, home improvement, entertainment, health & beauty products and a dedicated kids' section with renowned high-street brands.
name: Al Wahda Mall
address: 1 Hazza ' Bin Zayed The First St, Al Nahyan - Zone 1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of the United Arab Emirates, Abu Dhabi Art Hub stands as a pioneering artist community dedicated to fostering creativity and cultural exchange. This vibrant space invites international artists to live, create, and showcase their work while promoting collaboration among local and global talents. With its unique artist-in-residence programs that have welcomed over 200 creatives from around the world, Abu Dhabi Art Hub serves as a dynamic platform for artistic interaction.
name: Abu Dhabi Art Hub
address: At Tiblaghah 4 St, Musaffah - MW5 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Located 33 kilometers from the city center of Abu Dhabi, the Arabian Saluki Center is a cultural landmark and tourist attraction dedicated to the Saluki breed of dogs. It offers visitors a unique opportunity to delve into Arab heritage and history while also being perfect for dog enthusiasts. Visitors can enjoy interacting with the dogs owned by Shaikh Hamdan and witness the great rapport between them and their caretakers.
name: Arabian Saluki Center
address: CP42+H68, Sweihan Rd, near the Abu Dhabi International Airport - Al Shamkhah - SH34 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Hudayriyat Island in Abu Dhabi is a haven for fitness enthusiasts, offering top-notch sports facilities like cycling tracks and tennis courts. It's also a burgeoning community with food trucks, a beachfront area, and an aqua pool for kids' birthdays. The island boasts serene surroundings with lush greenery and turquoise waters, making it perfect for leisurely walks and family outings.
name: Hudayriyat Island
address: C87X+9G2, Al Hudayriat Island, Al Hidayriyyat - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: Abu Dhabi Corniche is a picturesque waterfront promenade that offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life. It features cycling paths, kids' play areas, fountains, and well-maintained gardens, making it an ideal spot for leisurely strolls with family and friends. The area is dotted with charming cafes and boasts stunning views of the high-rise towers that line the coast.
name: Abu Dhabi Corniche
address: F9R3+W8, Al Danah - Zone 1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

detail_description: AlBahar at the Corniche is a stunning beachfront destination in Abu Dhabi that perfectly blends leisure and entertainment. This vibrant locale features an array of activities, including AquaFun, the largest inflatable water park in the city, making it ideal for families seeking adventure. The beach is free to access and boasts ample parking nearby. On weekends, visitors can enjoy a lively atmosphere with live performances and beach volleyball games.
name: AlBahar at the Corniche
address: F88H+PVJ, Al Bateen - W10 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
